entry.title: 秦小厨的私房菜
entry.content: 这个blog中我将自己平常喜欢吃的菜或者喜欢做的菜菜谱分享出出来，由于我自己对于烹饪有很大的兴趣，但它更像一门“实验学科”需要不断地尝试。 秦小厨的私房菜菜谱蜜汁排骨 新鲜猪排（一斤左右）切小块，放入热水锅中，待血色消失，捞出沥干水分备用 热锅放入适量油，待油温足够热时加入冰糖，快速翻滚，此时火不易太大，否则容易糊。待冰糖融化，颜色开始变为焦黄时，加入刚才焯过水的猪排，快速翻炒，直至排骨表面变为黄色（此为着色）。 加入八角，香叶少许，姜切块（可以大块儿），蒜瓣（不用切），小葱（整根放入，可以打成结）。加入热水适量（这个比较难把握，需要试几次），盖上锅盖，大火煮15-20分钟 灰萝卜切滚刀块（不宜太小），放入锅中，小火闷25-30分钟。在这个过程中，要注意水是否烧干，容易糊。 待胡萝卜熟后，打开锅盖，大火收汁（5-10分钟左右）即可，可以翻动，确保不会黏在锅底。

entry.title: C programming
entry.content: Debug with C using GDBSegmentation faultThis is perhaps the most dauting bug we enconter, it may take a long time to identify the bug and why it happened. Suing the GDB debugger and the core file generated when a program dumps can be a life saving. But some linux distribution has a default setting that doesn’t generator core dump file(see this blog).In the terminal type1ulimit -a then set the core dump file size to be unlimited1ulimit -c unlimited Now run the excutatble file and it crashes with a core file in the current folder. Large array in C define the dimension of a arrary. The following definition is wrong123456789#include <stdio.h>#include <math.h>int main(){ int COl = 5; int ROW = 10; double Array[ROW][COL]; return 0;} The right method is123456789#include <stdio.h>#include <math.h>#define COL 5#define ROW 10int main(){ double Array[ROW][COL]; return 0;} Size of large array. By default, the C program allcoate a dynamic memory for the delcared array, this is inefficient when the size of array is large. A better way to do this is define them as staticor use malloc and free12345678#include <stdio.h>#include <math.h>#define COL 5#define ROW 10int main(){ static double Array[ROW][COL]; return 0; or we can do this12345678910#include <stdio.h>#include <math.h>#define COL 5#define ROW 10int main(){ double *Array = malloc(ROW*COL*sizeof(double)); free(Array); return 0; Install GCC in macFollow the instruction here and here. For mac users, the easiest way to install GCC is through1brew install gcc This will install the lateste version of gcc in /usr/l/usr/local/Cellar/gcc/7.2.0, to use it when compiling a c file, just1gcc-7 -g -o mytest mytest.c -I/User/shan/gsl/include -L/User/shan/gsl/lib -lgsl -lgslcblas -lm

entry.title: LaTex Note
entry.content: LaTex 简介既然我们有强大的 MS Word等文字处理软件，为何还要折腾LaTex？我的答案是，很多情况下Word对于排版真的是力不从心，尤其是当我们写比较复杂的文档时，比如博士论文，或者当文档中有比较多的数学或其他符号时。还记得在Word中插入公式时的那种生不如死的感觉吗？以及你插入的公式也许老板的电脑上还不能正确显示的时候。 相比于Word这种“所见即所得“的排版模式，LaTex更像是一种编程语言，它能让你更专注于写作内容本身，而不是花费大量的时间担心各种排版细节。这是我最喜欢LaTex的一个原因。关于排版和LaTex的发展历史，感兴趣的可以参看包太雷所著的《LaTex Note-雷太赫排版系统简介》(这是一本写作风格上十分幽默(逗比)，短小精悍的参考资料，非常值得一读)。以我自己写博士论文的经验来看，花费两天时间调教好博士论文LaTex模板，后续整个写作过程都不用担心诸如目录，图片插入位置、页眉、公式编号、交叉引用、参考文献格式等一些列繁琐的问题。仅仅这一点，就值得我们花点时间来学习并使用，个人强烈推荐用LaTex写博士论文(但唯一不足的是男神汤不使用LaTex，也许最好的办法是把他教会)。LEX排版相对于所见即所得系统的优势有 高质量，它制作的版面看起来更专业，数学公式尤其赏心悦目 结构化，文档结构清晰 批处理，源文件是文本文件，便于批处理 挂平台，兼容所有的操作系统 开源 不足之处 学习曲线较陡峭，需要一定的学习成本 制作文档过程繁琐，可能需要多次编译，不能实时看到结果 排版样式相对单一，缺乏灵活性 宏包质量良莠不齐 谈到LaTex的历史，就不得不提Donald E. Knuth老爷子(没错，就是那位写The Art of Computer Programming的作者，那套书已经写了四十多年了！)。1962年，24岁的他时候就着手写一本关于编译器的书，结果一发不可收拾，一下写了3000多页，结果出版商说这手稿太厚，最好分卷出版。而当1976年第二卷出版时，Knuth觉得排版是在难看(嗯，强迫症~)，于是一怒之下，决定自己写一个排版的引擎，这就是TEX的由来。1980 年代初期，斯坦福研究所 (Stanford Research Institute, SRI) 的 Leslie Lamport开发了一种新的格式，也就是 LATEX。 对于我们初学者来说，并不用知道诸如引擎、宏包和驱动的概念，这些都被封装在称之为”发行版“(distribution)中了。发行版有时也会带一个编辑器，但未必符合你的口味。常见的发行版如下表 操作系统 发行版 编辑器 通用 TeXLive TeXworks windows MikTeX TeXstudio Mac OS MacTex TeXshop ##LaTex的安装最简单和省心的方式就是直接安装整个发行版，根据自己的操作系统，选择相应的发行版。 Windows安装LaTex发行版Windows系统可在此处或清华镜像下载TexLive发行版并安装。 PDF阅读器常见的阅读器如Adobe PDF reader, Foxit PDF reader, skim等均可。 选择合适的编辑器这个就是根据个人的喜好了，如果你觉得发行版附带的编辑器不够好，你可以折腾Sublime Text 3之类的编辑器。 Mac OS建议直接从官网下载并安装MacTex。安装完后，这里面附带安装的有编辑器TeXshop, 一个迷你的编辑器LaTexiT(对于偶尔想在slides中加入数学公式，这是一个非常有用的工具), TexLive utility (用于LaTex宏包的安装和更新) 以及BibDesk (一个小巧的文献管理软件，在tex文档中插入参考文献时非常方便)。 PDF阅读器建议安装skim(一个非常轻量的pdf编辑器) 编辑器自带的TeXshop已经足够使用了，如果你像我一样对于”丑陋“无法容忍的话，你可以折腾优雅的Sublime Text 3或者使用TeXstudio Linux实验室里的同学中除了我似乎没有人使用linux系统，如果有谁需要在Linux系统下安装的话可以单独问我。 LaTex文档的基本结构和语法先贴出来一个简单的例子123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233\documentclass[12pt]{article}\usepackage{geometry}\geometry{a4paper} % or letter or a5paper or ... etc\usepackage{amsmath} % Math environment\usepackage{indent first} \usepackage{bm} % bold font in math environment\usepackage{bbold} % bold font for compelx math symbol\usepackage[backend = biber,style=nature]{biblatex} %set the bibliography stlye\usepackage{hyperref} %cross reference\hypersetup{colorlinks=true,citecolor=blue,linkcolor=red,anchorcolor=black,urlcolor=blue,pdfsubject={LaTeX},}% add the bibliographics path\addbibresource{/Users/shan/Documents/GoogleDrive/Latex notes/readingList/libraryReading.bib}\setlength{\parindent}{1em} % set the indent length of paragraph% title of the file\title{Literature reading list}%%% BEGIN DOCUMENT\begin{document}\maketitle\section{Olfaction project} % (fold)Here are the interesting or important papers that I prepared to read\cite{Kim2015,Wiechert2010,Rangan2012,Wick2010,Mathis2016,Ohshiro2017,Inada2017,Gorur-Shandilya2017,Tobin2017,Geramita2017,Rokni2014,Quast2017,Cafaro2016,Schwartz2001,Eichler2017}\printbibliography % print the bibilography\end{document} 编译出来是这样的 LaTex中比较tricky的是各种数学环境，在下面的例子中，我将尽可能地包含常见的数学环境。 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748\documentclass[12pt]{article}\usepackage{amsmath}\usepackage{amsfonts}\usepackage{mathtools}\begin{document}%公式的换行A example of a long equation. Using split can give you a nice format you want\begin{equation}\begin{split}\Delta \mathcal{F}&= \mathcal{F}_{i,I} - \mathcal{F}_{i,A} \\&= E_{0,i} + \ln(1+\sum_jc_jW_{ij}^A) - \ln(1+\sum_jc_jW_{ij}^I),\end{split}\end{equation}% 公式的对齐，这里的*号表示不给编号In this example, we want all the chemical reactions to align together but without numbering them\begin{align*} c_1 + R_i &\xrightleftharpoons[k_{1-}]{k_{1+}} R_ic_1,\\ \cdots\\ c_j + R_i &\xrightleftharpoons[k_{j-}]{k_{j+}} R_ic_j,\\\end{align*}% 公式组的对齐Here you can put \& where you want the equations to align\begin{align} a &= b+c+d \\ x &= y+z \end{align}% 多个公式，只给一个编号Sometimes several equations belong to the same group and you only want a single number or label for them\begin{equation}\begin{split}\chi_{11} &= \sum_{i=1}^{M}\Delta_1^{-4}\exp[2(\bar{c}_1 - K_{i1})],\\\chi_{22} &= \sum_{i=1}^{M}\Delta_2^{-4}\exp[2(\bar{c}_2 - K_{i2})],\\\chi_{12} &= \chi_{21} = \sum_{i=1}^{M}(\Delta_1 \Delta_2)^{-2}\exp(\bar{c}_1 + \bar{c}_2 - K_{i1} - K_{i2}),\end{split}\end{equation}% 分支公式use case environment\[ y=\begin{cases} -x,\quad x\leq 0 \\ x,\quad x>0\end{cases} \]% 数学字体%\mathbb 和 \mathfrak 需要 amsfonts 宏包，\mathscr 需要 mathrsfs 宏包。Without math environment $\mathrm{ABCDE}$,Math blackborad $\mathbb{RST}$, math bold $\mathbf{ABC}$, math calligraphy $\mathcal{ABCXYZ}$, $\mathtt{ABCXYZ}$\end{document} 编译出来的效果如下 中文环境的配置windows系统中对中文换机的支持是在导言区添加ctex宏包，如下例12345\documentclass{article}\usepackage[UTF8]{ctex}\begin{document}中文 English\end{document} Mac OS系统对中文环境的配置具体看一参考为 MacTeX 配置中文支持 一些有用的资料 Word count. TexCount is a project enable count of words in LaTex file. Simply downlaod and run the perl script texcount -[option] file 排版格式 manage .bib file Bibliography management with bibtex Bibliography management in LaTex natbib Using bibdesk to manage bibtex. I found it very convinent to use bibdesk, a very user-friend app under Mac OS X. When you write an article, you can import the bibtex entry of the papers you want site in a minimum bibtex style, so that you don’t need the abstract other stuffs in the .bib file. This really saved my life when I was preparing a Physics Review E manucript. LayoutUse geometry package to do sopholicated layout control. Page foot and header setup, details can be found in overleaf Syntax quotation . The simplest way to quote words or sentence is text’’ Use Eq.~(\ref{Eqn:label}) to cite equation Use split to split long equation insideequation environment, which only label once For array ##bibliograph and citationThe default biblatex citation stytle is natbib, here is the usage. The simplest example is 123456789%Import the natbib package and sets a bibliography and citation styles\usepackage{natbib}\bibliographystyle{abbrvnat}\setcitestyle{authoryear,open={((},close={))}}\begin{document}...%Imports the bibliography file "sample.bib"\bibliography{sample}\end{document} For a full list of stytle, see here The ohter management system is the package biblatex123456\usepackage[backend = biber,style=nature]{biblatex}\addbibresource{library.bib}\begin{document}...\printbibliography\end{document} BeamerStyle and layout suggestion of beamer presentation genearl tips for academic presentation Solve the math bold problem in other latex templateusing unicode-math 1234567891011121314\documentclass{article}\usepackage{unicode-math}\setmainfont{XITS}\setmathfont{XITS Math}\begin{document}This is a simple math example with a variable $k$.This works $\`{k}$.What I actually need is this: $\mathbfcal{X}$ and $\symbf{\Theta}$.Compare with $\mathcal{X}$ and $\Theta$.\end{document}

entry.title: Academic writing
entry.content: Writing your first paper can be daunting and scaring, especially for non native English speakers and without any training on academic writing. After years of struggling with your projects, you are ready to write a journal article to wrap all your exciting scientific discoveries. You set a goal and a time table aiming to finish your paper in two weeks. Every morning, you seat down, open your MS Word and start to write. You find it hard to get the words you want pop out and your mind eventually drifts away to other stuffs. After one hour, you find you could hardly write only a single paragraph. As the deadline approaches, you feel anxious and depressed. If you ever experience this kind of emotion, you are not alone. Even for native English speakers, writing academic paper is not an easy task. Writing paper is the central part of research, as George Whitesides put it “ ‘Interesting and unpublished’ is equivalent to ‘non-existent’ “. In this post, I will list all the resource and suggestions I got during my study in graduate school, hopefully, this will relieve some of the pain in writing your first paper. Some suggestionsAcademic writing differs a lot from other forms of writing. Here I summarize some online resources that I found very helpful when writing my first journal-like paper. While the source mainly focus on the field of biomedicine, it should also applicable to other STEM and even humanity disciplines. To improve writing quality, practice is essential. Rewriting and revision are also important. Only after several round of iterations between writing and revision, could a draft look like fulfill all the requirement for publication. Even good writers take rewrite seriously. What I learned is that when doing your first draft, you should just write and do not bother all the errors such as grammars and typos. The important thing is letting your though pour out without interruption. The general idea or principle of revision is using a “top-down” approach. A good revision strategy is starting from the outline.The first draft often looks awful and requires major revision. Revising your outline help you reorganize your thoughts in a more coherent and logical way. Don’t hesitate if you need delete some paragraphs in your first draft. Keep it in mind, less is more. When you are satisfied with the new outline, you can begin to put all the The outlineTo save time, one tip I have learned is that organize the outline and structure and discuss with others, such as your supervisor and colleagues. This can be done in various tools such as Xmind. One of the prominent scientist, George Whitesides, point it out “A good outline for the paper is also a good plan for the research program. You should write and rewrite these plans/outlines throughout the course of the research”. The practical advice I received on writing an outline is doing “brainstorm”. First, you write down all the idea, items, phrases that pop out from your mind. Then, you categorize that according to the categories. For example, some of them may belong to the “motivation” of your project. Some of them may fall into the “discussion” part, others may be grouped as “background” or “introduction”. Regular writing timeThe best practice to improving academic writing is find a regular time slot to write every day (or at least weekdays) and stick to it. You should make sure during that time block you will not be interrupted by other things. For me, I find it early in morning is an idea time for writing. Others may prefer the midnight. Writing is a highly intensive labor and demands a lot of energy and focus. To release the bitter, half an hour to one hour is enough everyday. At the beginning of your project, you might find there is not so much progress to write every day. You can write whatever you want, such as the summary of a talk in listen today, the interest thing you experienced, or even keep a diary. The key is sticking to it and foster this habit. After one month, you will feel more comfortable in writing in English. Take myself as an example. Although I have heard this advice from Prof. Bruce at the second year of my PhD study. I made mind to keep writing everyday for 10 mins, but failed after two weeks. But the second time when I decide to keep keep writing everyday was 2016, when I went back from UC Berkeley. I realized that I have to try my best to improve my English, including speaking and writing. To force my self to write, I volunteered to write a book on quantitative biology together with Chao. The writing process was so painful but also fruitful, at least it greatly improved my English writing skill. Had I know the difficulties, I would probably not volunteered to do it. The lesson I learned during writing that book is that no matter how hard it is, if you can stick to the time table, write regularly everyday, you will astonished by your own achievement. It really large strengthen my confidence of writing. As a comparison, it took me about one month to write my first paper in the early 2016, while I finished my first draft of my second paper in just one week last summer. Useful resource on academic writingHere I list several useful online writing source and books about academic writing How to write your first research paper. If I have to recommend only one short paper on writing, that’s it. This is wrote by an advisor in the center of career development at Cornell. It is well written and vividly express the emotional struggling we experienced when writing our first paper. How to write a paper in scientific journal stytle and format. This online source from Bates College provide comprehensive and doable tutorial on writing journal style paper in biomedical field. It is not very long and provides many practical advices in writing journal articles. Whitesides’ Group: Writing a paper. Suggestions on writing outline from a prominent scientist in Harvard. I could not agree more on his opinion. The process of crafting the outline is essentially a practice to condensate the idea and most important finding of your project. I provides a logical flow needed when you write which is from my point of view the most important ingredient of a good article. English Communication for Scientists. A column from Nature education, provides general guide principle not only on academic writing but also communication skills to general audience. How to write research articles. From UCSF career center, you can also find useful concise tips on delivering scientific presentation, designing a poster and job interview. I have not finish reading it, but it has a very good reputation. A manual for writers of research papers, theses and dissertations. 7th edition. The elements of stytle. By William Strunk Jr. This is perhaps the most famous book on writing On writing well - the classic guide to writing nonfiction. By William Zinsser. The craft of research. By Wayne Booth, Greg Colomb, and Joe Williams The Scientist’s Guide to Writing: How to Write More Easily and Effectively throughout Your Scientific Career. Academic writing for publish — A practical handbook. A field guide for science writers. Style— Toward clarity and grace. Writing science — how to write papers that get cited and proposals that get funded The sense of style. by Steven Pinker. The Chicago manual of style. entry.title: Coding tips
entry.content: saving and loading MATLAB structure define data structure mystruct = struct('fieldName1',[],'fieldName2',[],...), setting the values of each field: mystruct.fieldName1 = variable1. save struct preserve individual variables save(saveFileName, '-struct','mystruct') run matlab in command line or Linux cluster. Use varargin to pass parameters, use matlab -r "myscript(2)" to run matlab script. enable parallel computing. MATLAB has several parallel computing tool boxes enable you to use the multiple cores to accelerate your code. The simplest way is at the beginning of script, inserting matlabpool numberofpool (after MATLAB 2013b，it is replaced by parpool), at the end of script add matlabpool colse. It seems that you cannot put a breakpoint inside a parfor loop. passing external parameters * When running a MATLAB script or function on a Linux cluster, the easiest way to pass paramter is use ajob submission shell script and use matlab -r "myfunc(2)" to pass paramters. Other methods can be found here.matlabpool numberofpool (after MATLAB 2013b，it is replaced by parpool), at the end of script add matlabpool colse Handle large matrix After MATLAB 2011b, you can use MAT-file to save and load part of a .mat file which accelerate speed when you are running out of memory. The official document can be found here. Usage: first tranform the big mat file into MAT-file, use matObj = matfile('myBigData.mat'). But inorder to use this fucnction the save mat file has to be version 7.3 format, use save('myfile.mat','variables','-v7.3'). eval This is a very useful function especially when you want to evaluate a certain commond or phrases in a loop or in a string vector. feval is the corresponding function for function handles. Advanced programming techniques can be found here and here. Tips on writing MATLAB function. A stratege to overcome the downside of varargin is to specify the name of each parameters, by doing so you don’t need to worry about the orer of different arguments. For example : function myfunc(varargin) [A,B,C,D,E] = process_options(varargin,'A',3,'B',1,'C',2,'D',5,'E',9); A tutorial of debuging and optimization. Advanced graphics skill Best way to get the handle of a graphic is from the call. For example figH = figure(1,[10,200,10,200]) axH = axes().Or obtain the handle manually using gcf,gca and gco. Use get and set to query and set the value of objects of a graphic handle. V = get(han,'Property') V = set(han,'Property1','Val1') Axes properties From MATLAB 2014b, you can use different ways to specifiy the properties of axis. Figure 属性 Dock and undock figures You can set figures to be docked or not by setting figHandle.WindowStyle = 'docked' or 'normal'. This will be useful if you want to specify the size of figures and export them out. Print figure If your want to print the figure as you set, you need to set PaperPositionMode to be auto properties of axis Covert figures to LaTex-friend graphics. Either use matlabfrag,matlab2tikz,export_fig Since the default axis color of matalb figures is not pure black, this is really anoying . One way to set the default color into black is through the following command 1set(groot,{'DefaultAxesXColor','DefaultAxesYColor','DefaultAxesZColor'},{'k','k','k'}) Heat map of matrix, imagesc can generate good colormap, with set(gca,'CLim') argument, one can further make the color map a higher contrast. Fine tune and save graphics properties for further use. You can adjust the every aspect of a figure in the GUI, and the got to file–> generate code, it will generate a function that produce exactly what you see. This function can be repeatly used latter. Print vector eps. Some times the output of print -depsc does not give the right vector graphics, try adding1234% Sets RendererMode to 'manual' automaticallyfigure('Renderer', 'Painters'); % or using the followingprint(gcf,'-depsc','-painters','myEps') MATLAB graphicsAdvanced settings on MATLAB default graphic properties Default Plot Settings in Matlab This is an excellent post on this topic. gram packagehere is the gram package, which mimic the famous ggplot2 pacakge in R, generating publish-quality graphics Chebfun packageA very useful numerical tool box for computing almost any function. see here for more detail. They also published a book of ODEs with many MATLAB analysis, can be freely downloaded here. An online tutorial is also provided Some tips in writing matlab scripts Block comments. You can you %{ and %} pair to comment a block of code Causion of global variables. To make sure you delete the global variables after finish using them Passing extral parameter to complex function. Some times a complex function use another function as arguement, which itself contain other parameters 1234567891011121314%define function in extral m-filefunction [r1 r2] = myFun(x,a,b,c) % a,b,c are extral parameters r1 = build_in_fun(x,a,b); r2 = build_in_fun(x,a,c);end%in the main script% set the parametersa = a1;b = b1;c = c1;passFun = @(x)myFun(x,a,b,c); %define it after assigning values ot a,b,creturn = mainFun(passFun, para1,para2,options) Debug and breakpoint can be found here and here Passing extral parameter to the function1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526% define the function with extral parameter parsingfunction a = findArea(width,varargin) defaultHeight = 1; defaultUnits = 'inches'; defaultShape = 'rectangle'; expectedShapes = {'square','rectangle','parallelogram'}; p = inputParser; validScalarPosNum = @(x) isnumeric(x) && isscalar(x) && (x > 0); addRequired(p,'width',validScalarPosNum); addParameter(p,'height',defaultHeight,validScalarPosNum); addParameter(p,'units',defaultUnits,@isstring); addParameter(p,'shape',defaultShape,... @(x) any(validatestring(x,expectedShapes))); addOptional(p,'test',1,@isnumeric) parse(p,width,varargin{:}); a = p.Results.width*p.Results.height; end% now you can call the function in servearl waysa = findArea(7);a = findArea(7,3);a = findArea(13,'shape','square');a = findArea(13,'units',"miles",'shape','square'); Dealing with dependency 确定程序依赖项. 使用 matlab.codetools.requiredFilesAndProducts('myFun.m') 可以详细列出myFun.m 所依赖的其他文件。 Generating correlation matrix Some methods used to generate random or structured random correlation matrix see here use imgesc to plot a heatmap of matrix, the color style can be customed Use the build in function gallery('randcorr',X), where the eigenvalues are specified by X,whose sum should be n, the dimension of correlation matrix MATLAB parallel toolBefore MATLAB 2014, we can use parfor and matlabpool local numWorkers to parallelize the code. In MATLAB 2017, the implementation is more flexible and the utilization of parfor is slightly different, we don’t need to explicilty open matlab pool before parfor. See the document for more information. A simple example is1234567function y = specify_num_workers(w) y = ones(1,100); % w specifies maximum number of workers parfor (i = 1:100,w) y(i) = i; endend When runining the parallel program on cluster, using parpool(N) to explicitly handle the timeout issue1parpool(4, 'IdleTimeout', Inf) ###Explicit Paralleization MathWorks now offers two MATLAB toolboxes dedicated to parallelization: the Parallel Computing Toolbox (PCT), and the MATLAB Distributed Computing Server (MDCS) Implicit multithreading is automatically employed by numerous built-in MATLAB functions Explicit multiprocessing: Multiple instances of MATLAB run on several processors, often with shared memory, and execute a single MATLAB command or M-function concurrently. Supported by dedicated PCT programming constructs Distributed computing: Multiple instances of MATLAB run multiple independent computations on separate computers, each with its own memory, typically in a cluster, grid or cloud. ###The Parallel Computing Toolbox Using more workers than available cores generally decreases performance due to increased task-switching and communication overheads the iteration values of a parfor statement must be increasing consecutive integers ###The MATLAB Distributed Computing Server PCT only allows us to access computing resources (CPU cores or GPUs) on the same machine (node). It does not enable work parallelization across separate com- puting nodes (cluster, grid, or cloud) To run task across multiple nodes need some configuration of the MATLAB, see here for example. I also tried to test this in a folder /Users/shan/Documents/MATLAB/paralTest and /home/tangc_pkuhpc/lustre1/ssqin/olfactoryCoding/optiInterMatrix/paralTest. See also chapter 6 of the book acceleration MATLAB performance Random number generation​ Rejection sampling, simple yet inefficient run matlab on cluster . When use batch to submit same program running on different CPU, one should causion about the random number seed. We can use sleep 1s in shell script, or reading an extral random number as the seeds. Sparse matrix use spfun(myFun,S), where myFun is a function handle, S is the sparse matrix. Permenantly add folder and subfolders to the MATLAB searching path Uisng the startup.m file. Creat the file under the path /Applications/MATLAB_R2016b.app/toolbox/local' or/opt/MATLAB2017a/toolbox/local’12345678% set the default folder when matlab startcd /full/path/of/folder/you/want% add pathaddpath folername%also add subfoldersaddpath(genpath('foldername')) Mathematica install 破解版. 还有这个 C languagesome tutorial [online learning ]https://www.cprogramming.com/tutorial/c-tutorial.html 内存管理 Valgrind and also here IBM general introduction [Xcode instrument检查内】(http://blog.csdn.net/Zsk_Zane/article/details/52016411) Useful packages t-SNE CLS 集群作业调度系统 SLURM 官网介绍 1234567PARTITION AVAIL TIMELIMIT NODES STATE NODELISTdebug* up 30:00 1 down* c12b01n02debug* up 30:00 1 idle c12b01n01cn-test up 13-00:00:0 1 drain* c01b01n01cn-test up 13-00:00:0 5 idle c01b01n[02-06]cn-large up 5-00:00:00 7 drain* c13b04n[01,04],c15b04n[07,10],c16b02n14,c16b04n[01,05]cn-large up 5-00:00:00 30 dow Here the following debug means that the default partition for submitted jobs. entry.title: MathJax Example
entry.content: MathJax is a simple way of including Tex/LaTex/MathML based mathematics in HTML webpages. To get up and running you need to include the MathJax script in the header of your github pages page, and then write some maths. For LaTex, there are two delimiters you need to know about, one for block or displayed mathematics \[ ... \], and the other for inline mathematics \( ... \). UsageTo enable MathJax support be sure Kramdown is your Markdown flavor of choice and MathJax is set to true in your _config.yml file. 12markdown: kramdownmathjax: true 12Here is an example MathJax inline rendering \\( 1/x^{2} \\), and here is a block rendering: \\[ \frac{1}{n^{2}} \\] Here is an example MathJax inline rendering \( 1/x^{2} \), and here is a block rendering:\[ \frac{1}{n^{2}} \] The only thing to look out for is the escaping of the backslash when using markdown, so the delimiters become \\[ ... \\] and \\( ... \\) for inline and block maths respectively. $$\begin{align} & \phi(x,y) = \phi \left(\sum_{i=1}^n x_ie_i, \sum_{j=1}^n y_je_j \right) = \sum_{i=1}^n \sum_{j=1}^n x_i y_j \phi(e_i, e_j) = \ & (x_1, \ldots, x_n) \left( \begin{array}{ccc} \phi(e_1, e_1) & \cdots & \phi(e_1, e_n) \ \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \ \phi(e_n, e_1) & \cdots & \phi(e_n, e_n) \end{array} \right) \left( \begin{array}{c} y_1 \ \vdots \ y_n \end{array} \right)\end{align}$$
